result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Boss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael J Boss in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Defendant Michael J Boss in custody.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF131, 15CF142. DE will have credit for 246 days credit in 15CF131 and 216 days in 15CF142.  DE makes a statement to the court. 15CF131-court will order 5 years, 2 in/3 out. Follow DOC recocommendations, concurrent to 15CF142.  15CF142-12 month jail each count, concurrent, will have credit for time served.

Defendant Michael J Boss in court with attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Defendant Michael J Boss in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Heard along with 15CF131, 15CF142, 15CF182.  DE will waive PH hearing in 15CF182, court instructs on waiver of PH, will accept waiver, Court finds probable cause exists, will bind over for JT.  Information filed by the State.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter plea's in 15CF131-Ct 1, repeater dismissed and 15CF142-Ct's 1 and 2, repeater dismissed.  Ct 2 in 15CF131, 15CF122, 15CF142-Ct 3 and 15CF182 will be DRI.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  DE makes a statement to the court, wishes to seek treatment and counseling.

15CF142-NC, withhold sentence, 3 years probation, each count, concurrent with 15CF131 and each count,  CC, DNA surcharge, complete all programming recommended by the DOC.  Repeater dismissed on each case.
